main event: An observer reported seeing a bright object in the sky which was initially thought to be a meteor while swimming in Lake Michigan near Saugatuck, Michigan.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on July 6, 1962, at 11:51 PM and lasted for approximately one minute initially, then again spotted at 12:32 AM., The object was described as bright, with two colors, and moving westerly across the sky., The observer thought the object covered an arc of 25 - 30 degrees during each sighting., There were comparisons made that the object's speed suggested it could complete an orbit around the Earth in about 14 or 15 minutes., The report mentions a former employee of System Development Corporation with a background in the USAF.
sighted object: a bright object in the sky, possibly a meteor
witness description: a former employee of System Development Corporation with a background in the USAF
